addressleaf.section:
To the right honorable S
r
Francis Walsingham Knight Principal Secretary to her Ma
tie
.

18 Ap
r
1590 M
r
Bodeley to M
r
Secretary Walsing
h
decessed./

S
r
Thomas Bodeley and
M
r
Wilkes
their letters from
e
Haugh

page.lettertext:
fol.49r
It may please yo
r
H. to be advertised,
at
I receaved yo
r
letters of
e 6 of Marche,
the 5 of April, together w
t
her
Ma
ties
to the
General states
, and to
Count Maurice
. The
General states have dispatched copies of her
Hig
nes
letters to their Provinces, from whome
they expect a speedy resoluc
o
n. In
e meane
season they seeme to make no difficultie, about
the accomplishing of her demaunde. Also
Count Maurice, being Admiral, hath promised
therein his uttermost furtherance, declaring
unto me, that all their shippes are in a very
good readines, and that there wanteth no
more, but
e Contrey to resolve, and her Ma
tie
to send hither. The present answear w
ch
is made by those that are heere for
e Gene-
rall states, I have sent yo
r
H. heerew
t
,
and likewise a letter from
e Court.
The late charge, whiche I receaved from my
LL. of
e Councel, w
t
my
L. Treasuro
rs
letter,
contening divers pointes, wherein I was to
deale w
t
e General states, I have answeared
in my letter to my LL. and to my L. Trea-
suro
r
, from whome it may please yo
r
H. to
receave
e informac
o
n, of all that I have
certified.
And so I take my humble leave.
From
e Hage. A
p
18. 1590
Yo
r
H. most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley
